eeguana 0.0.7.9000

Reference

About

eeguana

eeguana: A package for flexible manipulation of EEG data.

Reading functions

Functions for reading external files (BrainVision and mat files from Fieldtrip) and return an eeg_lst. (Upcoming: eeglab and edf files).

read_edf()

Read an edf/edf+/bdf file into R

read_ft()

Read a Fieldtrip file into R

read_vhdr()

Read a BrainVision file into R

Tidyverse 'dplyr'(-like) functions and extensions

Functions that overload some dplyr functions and always return an eeg_lst.

mutate(<eeg_lst>) transmute(<eeg_lst>) filter(<eeg_lst>) summarise(<eeg_lst>) group_by(<eeg_lst>) ungroup(<eeg_lst>) groups(<eeg_lst>) group_vars(<eeg_lst>) select(<eeg_lst>) select(<ica_lst>) rename(<eeg_lst>) rename(<ica_lst>)

Dplyr functions for manipulating eeg_lst objects.

anti_join(<eeg_lst>) left_join(<eeg_lst>) semi_join(<eeg_lst>)

Dplyr functions for joining data frames to the segments of eeg_lst objects.

bind()

Bind eeg_lst objects.

summarize_at_ch() summarize_all_ch() summarise_at_ch() summarise_all_ch()

Summarize multiple channels

Specialized summarizing functions

Functions that apply a series of dplyr functions to return useful summaries.

channel_names() nchannels() component_names() ncomponents() nsamples() summary(<eeg_lst>) print(<eeg_summary>)

Display information of the eeg_lst object.

count_complete_cases_tbl()

Count number of complete segments of an eeg_lst object.

Channel functions

Functions that act on the channels of the signal table. They have a default version that acts on all the channels, and can be used inside a mutate call for more control.

ch_baseline()

Baseline an eeg_lst

ch_rereference()

Rereference a channel or group of channels.

downsample() segment() interpolate_tbl() event_to_ch_NA() eeg_intervals_to_NA() ch_filt_low_pass() ch_filt_high_pass() ch_filt_band_pass() ch_filt_stop_pass() events() `events<-`()

Deprecated functions in eeguana

chs_fun()

Get the by-sample (or by-row) function of the specified channels.

chs_mean()

Get the by-sample (or by-row) mean of the specified channels.

EEG-specialized functions

Functions for applying specialized actions on signal table or the entire eeg_lst.

downsample() segment() interpolate_tbl() event_to_ch_NA() eeg_intervals_to_NA() ch_filt_low_pass() ch_filt_high_pass() ch_filt_band_pass() ch_filt_stop_pass() events() `events<-`()

Deprecated functions in eeguana

eeg_artif_minmax() eeg_artif_step()

Annotate artifacts in the events table of an eeg_lst.

eeg_downsample()

Downsample EEG data

eeg_events_to_NA()

Remove (transform to NA) problematic events from an eeg_lst.

eeg_ica()

EEG signal decomposition using Independent Component Analysis (ICA)

eeg_interpolate_tbl()

Create a table with interpolated signals of an eeg_lst object.

eeg_lst()

Create an eeg_lst

eeg_segment()

Segment an eeg_lst.

eeg_filt_low_pass() eeg_filt_high_pass() eeg_filt_band_pass() eeg_filt_band_stop()

Apply a zero-phase low-pass, high-pass, band-pass, or band-stop FIR filter.

Plot functions

Wrappers to ggplot functions that first transform the eeg_lst to a wide tibble, together with some transformation (downsampling, interpolation, etc).

plot(<eeg_lst>)

Create a basic signal plot

plot_gg()

Create an ERP plot

plot_in_layout()

Arrange ERP plots according to scalp layout

plot_topo()

Create a topographic plot

annotate_head()

Add a head shape to a ggplot

'base'-inspired functions

Functions for getting specific information about the objects that compose an eeg_lst.

as_eeg_lst()

to.data object

as_sample_int()

Convert a time point into a sample.

as_tibble(<eeg_lst>) as_data_frame.eeg_lst() as_long_tbl(<eeg_lst>)

Convert an eeg_lst to a long table in tibble format.

as_time()

Convert a sample point into a time point.

as.data.frame(<eeg_lst>)

Convert an eeg_lst to a (base) data frame.

as.data.table.eeg_lst()

Convert an eeg_lst to a long table in data.table format.

is_channel_dbl()

Test if the object is a channel This function returns TRUE for channels.

is_component_dbl()

Test if the object is a component This function returns TRUE for components.

is_eeg_lst()

Test if the object is an eeg_lst. This function returns TRUE for eeg_lsts.

is_events_tbl()

Test if the object is an events_tbl This function returns TRUE for events_tbl.

is_sample_int()

Test if the object is a sample This function returns TRUE for samples.

is_signal_tbl()

Test if the object is a signal_tbl This function returns TRUE for signals.

channel_names() nchannels() component_names() ncomponents() nsamples() summary(<eeg_lst>) print(<eeg_summary>)

Display information of the eeg_lst object.

Editing functions

Functions for editing eeg_lst objects.

events_tbl()

Functions to get or set the events table of an eeg_lst object.

channels_tbl() `channels_tbl<-`()

Functions to get or set the channel information of an eeg_lst object.

Constructor functions

Internal functions for creating objects.

eeg_lst()

Create an eeg_lst

ica_lst()

Builds an eeg_lst.

component_dbl()

Builds a component.

sample_int()

Builds a series of sample numbers.

channel_dbl()

Builds a channel.

Others

Some other useful functions.

change_coord()

Change coordinate system from 3D to 2D

rpink()

Generates pink noise

Example data sets

Example data sets in eeg_lst format.

data_faces_10_trials

EEGs elicited when one subject saw faces and non-faces objects.

data_faces_ERPs

ERPs elicited when one subject saw faces and non-faces objects.
